statements.name: PROC REGISTERMODEL
statements.description: Registers DATA step and analytic store models in SAS Model Manager.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name to register the model under in SAS Model Manager.

arguments.name: ALGORITHM=
arguments.description: specifies the algorithm that was used to train the model. This can be specified as a quoted string or as a key value. Key values include the following: BINNING, BNET, BOOLRULE, ENSEMBLE, FACTMAC, FOREST, GAM, GLM, GRADBOOST, IMPUTE, LINEARREG, LOGISTIC, MWPCA, NEURAL, NPLR, OTHER, PCA, PLSREG, QUANTREG, REPLACE, RPCA, RULEBASED, SVD, SVDD, SVM, TEXTTOPIC, TREE.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC REGISTERMODEL to use.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies the description of the model.

arguments.name: FUNCTION=
arguments.description: specifies the model function type. Key values include the following: ANALYTICAL, CLASSIFICATION, CLUSTERING, IMAGE_CLASSIFICATION, IMAGE_SEGMENTATION, KEYPOINTS_DETECTION, OBJECT_DETECTION, PREDICTION, SEGMENTATION, SINGLE_SERIES_FORECASTING, TEXT_CATEGORIZATION, TEXT_CONCEPTS, TEXT_SENTIMENT, TEXT_TOPICS, TRANSFORMATION.

arguments.name: MODELER=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the modeler.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: specifies that you want to replace an existing model with a new one if the new model would have the same model name in the same project.

statements.name: ASSESSMENT
statements.description: Assesses the model and registers assessment statistics in SAS Model Manager.

arguments.name: FREQ=
arguments.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table and the holdout data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation.

arguments.name: HOLDOUT=
arguments.description: names the holdout data table for assessment.

arguments.name: NCUTS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of cuts to use in the ROC calculation.

arguments.name: PARTITIONVAR=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the input data set to be used to decide whether an observation is used for one of the three roles: training, validation, or testing.

statements.name: ASTOREMODEL
statements.description: Specifies the analytic store to be registered.

arguments.name: STORE=
arguments.description: names the external file that contains the analytic store that holds the model to be registered.

statements.name: CODE
statements.description: Specifies the DATA step code to be registered.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: names the external file that contains the DATA step code to be registered.

statements.name: PROJECT
statements.description: Specifies the project in which to register the model.

arguments.name: FOLDER=
arguments.description: specifies the folder name where the SAS Model Manager project resides.

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: specifies the ID of an existing SAS Model Manager project to register the model in.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS Model Manager project to register the model in.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the repository where the SAS Model Manager project folder resides.

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: Specifies the variable whose values the model tries to predict.

arguments.name: LEVEL=
arguments.description: specifies the level of measurement of the target variable.

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the event level of the target. If LEVEL=BINARY or NOMINAL, then you must also specify EVENT=.
